data.answer: In the event of unforeseen circumstances where the Company-designated PURSER is incapacitated, the Pilot in command is responsible for nominating the cabin crewmember with the highest seniority to assume the duties and responsibilities of the PURSER, provided no alternate has already been assigned by In-flight Services. Before boarding the aircraft, a full review of all relevant safety/emergency provisions needs to be held during the crew briefing. [39] The Pilot in command must ensure that the newly assigned person properly conducts the responsibilities of the Purser which include being responsible for the conduct and coordination of cabin safety and emergency procedures, the observation of these procedures by cabin crew and passengers, and reporting of any irregularities and malfunctions [39][39].
